ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The history of Canada - especially French Canada - from New France to the Quiet Revolution and Quebecois separatism, as well as some emphasis on other parts of French North America (Louisiana and Franco-New England).
I learned lots on Canadian history and writing skills.
lots of information about Canada, Louisiana, colonization, culture, etc.
Learned to enjoy the social element of seminars!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: seminar is engaging, Prof. Gitlin makes the material relevant and accessible, sense of class community. I also like the policy that many readings are not strictly required, but the more you do, the more you get out of the course.
Weaknesses: weekly emails, and especially the syllabus, could be better organized - but this is fairly minor!

strengths: super in-depth explanation about Canadian history
weakness: sometimes moved too quickly.. hard to keep up and understand everything
Strength: community. Weakness: lack of structure.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! I found the material and seminar meetings quite interesting. It's also a great writing credit, as the class is slightly lighter at the end of the semester to give you time to write and the professor will give you many suggestions for paper topics, and it's a great opportunity to develop a relationship with a writing tutor.
Yes I would. It was very informative and exciting
Yes. Professor Gitlin is a gem and is such a great professor to be around. His passion for the material is so apparent in every class. He is very knowledgable and thorough.
Yes! Everyone should take a class with Prof. Gitlin.
